definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: They sallied forth early in the morning.
I remild paind Beijing early in the morning.
His coup of early this morning had been reported.
sentences.chinese: 他今天一清早干的好事已经报案了。

sentences.english: What, eventually, will become of us who so quickly grow lukewarm?
sentences.chinese: 我们一清早，就这样冷淡，后来更将怎样呢？

sentences.english: He set off early in the morning with the breakfast untouched.
sentences.chinese: 他一清早就走了，早饭一动也没动。

sentences.english: In the early morning,she robed and went out.
sentences.chinese: 一清早她穿上衣服就出去了。

sentences.english: Sunday trippers spun away early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 星期天的旅游者一清早就乘车离开了。

sentences.english: InsertA: He got home late last night, or rather early this morning.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天半夜，更准确地说，今天一清早才回到家。

sentences.english: Who is coming here so early in the morning?
sentences.chinese: 他向自己说，“谁这样一清早就来了？”

sentences.english: Early next morning, she saw a light ahead .
sentences.chinese: 第二天一清早，她看见前面有灯光。

sentences.english: He left early in the morning and should be home by now.
sentences.chinese: 他一清早就走了，这早晚多半已经到家了。

sentences.english: He got home late last night, or rather early this morning.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天半夜里，更确切地说，今天一清早才回到家。

sentences.english: Early in the morning, they set sail southward.
sentences.chinese: 一清早，他们启航向南行驶。

sentences.english: The farmer routed his sons out of bed early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 这位农夫一清早就把几个儿子从床上叫起来。

sentences.english: Then, early Christmas morning, the little girl's eyes suddenly fluttered open.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节的一清早，小女孩的眼睛突然颤抖抖地睁开了。

definition: at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
erhua variant of 一大早[yi1 da4 zao3]
(dialect) to begin to dawn/to be just getting light
as soon as possible/as early as one can
